comment: super straightforward! quizzes weekly and you get two attempts on them, lectures are easy to follow and he explains material well. no homework outside of that. he always tries talking to the class and jokes around, great professor!
TAKE HIM!! don't understand why he doesn't have better reviews but he's easy. I took him online.

I took him in the Summer of 2024, there were 21 quizzes, 3 exams, and 1 final exam (lowest quiz and exam gets dropped). He gives out 2 extra credit opportunities. The exam and quizzes were no lock down, and there was no webcam. He was easy and responded quickly to emails. Yes, there are a lot of quizzes but it is super easy just use your resources!
The class was pretty easy with really good extra credit. As long as you study the quizzes you'll do well on the final.

He goes fast during lectures, but he has slowed down. No homework, 6 quizzes (one of the quizzes is dropped), and a final. Do good on the quizzes and you can't fail the final. He also offers extra credit for showing up to additional sessions and making an effort to always attend class. Really chill and a great guy who will help you if asked.

Slade's class is lecture-heavy with no homework. His lectures go over everything that needs to be learned with opportunities for extra credit but submit the slides a week or two after they were presented, meaning that if a lecture was missed and it will take a while before the missed information is learned. Fun class that does not ask for too much.

Lectures are easy to understand, makes notes available in D2L after class, and gives plenty of opportunities for extra cred. He also does these fun survey things for attendance that typically ask about like favorite movies or tv shows just to grab everyone's attention. Overall, class is very chill and fairly easy to follow, would take him again.

I thought he was awesome! You have to attend the classes and lectures in order to stay on top of things! He was super relatable and wanted his students to succeed. He gives extra credit opportunity and provides so many ways for you to learn and understand. I would definitely recommend and take again!

Professor Charlie Dale made the course hard. Harsh grader and needs to relax testing standards. Students want to know what they missed on their exams so you shouldn't keep the submitted exam from other students. I think you'd need to worry more about students understanding the material instead of worrying if they're gonna cheat. DO NOT TAKE AT ALL!

Slade made the course challenging for all students. Multiple students recount having trouble in a base level course while feeling as though the content was used from a upper-level course. Grading was unclear and while attendance is far from mandatory, students should show up irregardless of health concerns and mental health issues. DON'T TAKE!
